Article.ArticleTitle: Mass spectrometric monitoring of oxidation of aliphatic C6-C8 hydrocarbons and ethanol in low pressure oxygen and air plasmas.

AbstractText: Experimental and theoretical studies on the oxidation of saturated hydrocarbons (n-hexane, cyclohexane, n-heptane, n-octane and isooctane) and ethanol in 28 Torr O<sub>2</sub> or air plasma generated by a hollow cathode discharge ion source were made. Ions corresponding to [M + 15]<sup>+</sup> and [M + 13]<sup>+</sup> in addition to [M - H]<sup>+</sup> and [M - 3H]<sup>+</sup> were detected as major ions where M is the sample molecule. The ions [M + 15]<sup>+</sup> and [M + 13]<sup>+</sup> were assigned as oxidation products, [M - H + O]<sup>+</sup> and [M - 3H + O]<sup>+</sup> , respectively. By the tandem mass spectrometry analysis of [M - H + O]<sup>+</sup> and [M - 3H + O]<sup>+</sup> , H<sub>2</sub> O, olefins (and/or cycloalkanes) and oxygen-containing compounds were eliminated from these ions. Ozone as one of the terminal products in the O<sub>2</sub> plasma was postulated as the oxidizing reagent. As an example, the reactions of C<sub>6</sub> H<sub>14</sub><sup>+•</sup> with O<sub>2</sub> and of C<sub>6</sub> H<sub>13</sub><sup>+</sup> (CH<sub>3</sub> CH<sub>2</sub> CH<sup>+</sup> CH<sub>2</sub> CH<sub>2</sub> CH<sub>3</sub> ) with ozone were examined by density functional theory calculations. Nucleophilic interaction of ozone with C<sub>6</sub> H<sub>13</sub><sup>+</sup> leads to the formation of protonated ketone, CH<sub>3</sub> CH<sub>2</sub> C(=OH<sup>+</sup> )CH<sub>2</sub> CH<sub>2</sub> CH<sub>3</sub> . In air plasma, [M - H + O]<sup>+</sup> became predominant over carbocations, [M - H]<sup>+</sup> and [M - 3H]<sup>+</sup> . For ethanol, the protonated acetic acid CH<sub>3</sub> C(OH)<sub>2</sub><sup>+</sup> (m/z 61.03) was formed as the oxidation product. The peaks at m/z 75.04 and 75.08 are assigned as protonated ethyl formate and protonated diethyl ether, respectively, and that at m/z 89.06 as protonated ethyl acetate.
